string-array.item:
\u2022 Encourage the person to support the injury with their hand or use a cushion or items of clothing to prevent unnecessary movement.\n
\u2022 If the injured area is obviously deformed the broken bone is protruding through the skin, the area below the injury is numb, pale, blue or cold, the injury is significantly painful, or the person cannot be safely transformed to a medical facility, call Emergency service to get someone else to do it.\n \u2022 Make sure the injury is supported until help arrives

• The person may have Pressure, tightness, pain, or a squeezing or aching sensation in your chest or arms that may spread to your neck, jaw or back. The person may also experience. The person may have nausea, indigestion, heartburn or abdominal pain, shortness of breath, cold sweat, fatigue, light-headedness or sudden dizziness.
 • call Emergency service to get someone else to do it.
 • Have the person chew either 1 regular-strength or 2 low-dose ASA(Aspirin) tablets, if the person is not allergic.
 • Have the person rest quietly in a comfortable position.
 • Give them constant reassurance while waiting for EMS personnel.

• The persons skin may be hot or red and may also be dry or moist; they may be experiencing a severe headache, altered behaviours, change in responsiveness, rapid, shallow breathing, and a high body temperature.
 • Call 911 as soon as possible or get someone else do it.
 • Move the person to a cooler place. Remove or loosen tight clothing. Fan the person. Actively cool the person by immersing the persons body in cool water, immersing the forearms in cool water, or pouring water on the persons torso. Apply cool, wet clothes or towels to the skin. If they are alert, give small amounts of cool water to drink. Make sure they drink slowly.
 • If needed, cool, wet clothes or towels applied to the skin or ice packs wrapped in a cloth applied to the wrists, ankles, groin, neck, and armpits can be used for cooling.

\u2022 Have them rest quietly and apply a cold compress to the injury (e.g. ice pack, frozen vegetables wrapped in a towel).\n \u2022 If they become confused or drowsy, have impaired vision, balance or breathing, or they experience weakness, tingling, loss of sensation or vomiting, call EMS or get someone else to do it.\n

Remember RICE: 
 • Rest 
 • Immobilixe 
 • Cold 
 • Elevate.

\u2022 Cool the burn under cool running water, or with a cool (not freezing) compress, for at least ten minutes. \n \u2022 If the burn requires further medical care, cover the burn loosely with a dry, sterile dressing.
